text: The FBI Scientific Crime Detection Laboratory (known then only as the Technical Crime Laboratory) officially opened in Washington DC. It's location was chosen because it had a sink, and its one employee, Agent Charles Appel had to borrow a microscope.

The Apollo 12 command module with its all-Navy crew splashed down safely in the Pacific Ocean, ending the second manned mission to the Moon. Credit goes to the USS Hornet for its second flawless recovery effort.
AOL announced it would purchase Netscape Communications, merging what were then two of the biggest names on the Internet.
